issues.description: In the solution implementation of Lecture.java the declared fields use snake_case names (lecture_name, number_of_inscribed_students, etc.) but every reference in the constructor, getters/setters and methods uses camelCase names (lectureName, numberOfInscribedStudents, etc.). This mismatch will cause compiler errors and prevent the student from running or studying the provided solution.
issues.suggested_fix: Rename the private fields to camelCase (lectureName, numberOfInscribedStudents, numberOfGuestStudents, numberOfLecturers, numberOfTutors) so that they match all uses in the constructor, getters/setters, and other methods.

issues.description: The solution repository declares private fields using snake_case (e.g., `lecture_name`, `number_of_inscribed_students`, etc.) while the problem statement and UML diagram use camelCase identifiers (`lectureName`, `numberOfInscribedStudents`, etc.). This mismatch will confuse students trying to map the specified attribute names to the implementation and even leads to non-existent field references in the constructor and methods.
issues.suggested_fix: Rename the private fields in Lecture.java to use camelCase matching the UML and problem statement (e.g., `private String lectureName;`, `private int numberOfInscribedStudents;`, etc.) so that the field names align with constructor parameters and getters/setters.
